item.title: New Doll
item.description: New Doll Translated from the original Bengali by Bhaswati Ghosh Changing tastes There was a master craftsman who made dolls as playthings for little girls of the royal family. Every year, a doll fair was held in the palace courtyard. All other artisans accorded the master the highest honour at the fair. When he was nearly eighty years old, there came a new craftsman. Youthful in age and fresh in his style, he was called Kishanlal.
